pros: great staff, helpful with no employees, great teamwork

pros: The staff I work with are great.

job_title: Blood Bank Supervisor in Ottumwa, IA
pros: I can't think of any good reasons

review_title: Trying to improve, but missing the mark
pros: Caring staff, accessible, community involvement, decent benefits, smaller community, an above average number of services, multiple locations for clinics in and around community
cons: Corporate culture is not open, micromanagement, not empowering, some punitive culture, management is inaccessible and undervalues staff, recruiting out of touch with reality of corporation, slow decision making, not forward thinking, no company match 401(k), poor reputation in community, knee-jerk response to issues - tend to leap before looking when addressing problems, five providers in the past four years opted to buyout contact over staying for the remaining 1.5 years, three providers in five years opted not to renew contract, NPs considered dispensable commodities- hired for one role and moved from location to location to plug holes, no consistent or collegial physician liaison for clinical questions- physicians prefer formal consult and visit with patient often resulting in "transfer of care due to complexity of case"

pros: The staff is great to work with! Amazing nurses!  Offers Tuition reimbursement, but you owe two years or you have to pay it back.
cons: Does not promote from within, does not pay well, does not appreciate the work you do and does not have a retirement plan, 401k

review_title: The hospital staff in general are great to work with
pros: The shift I worked was great. I worked with some good people, however like many other places, there's always someone who can sometimes create an uncomfortable work environment.
cons:
The benefits package can use some improvements.  
There can be some unprofessional ism amungst management and other employees

review_title: busy, pushing forward without knowing all the details
